intro: Trasus pallescens, commonly known as the pale Trasus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical climates. Trasus pallescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and unique coloration.
